result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephean A Hoya was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit For Time Served 36 Days, If Revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Costs and Surcharges to be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month starting 09-02-2014 as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Complete High School Education.

Maintain/Obtain full time employment.

AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Continue in AODA and Health and Human Services.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
Continue with a Cognitive Thinking Course.
Obtain a valid driver's license within the First 6 month of Probation.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

supervisions.notes:
COURT DEEMS TIME SERVED.
64 Days Straight Time (Jail).
Credit For Time Served 64 Days.

05-19-2015:  6 MONTHS STAYED IS NOW PERMANENTLY STAYED.

First 3 months Straight Time (Jail), Last 3 months Huber with standard release conditions.  ALL 6 MONTHS STAYED - FOR 6 MONTHS DAY REPORT CENTER:  120 days.  If defendant successfully completes Day Report Center, the 6 months previously imposed will be Permanently STAYED.

Probation Revoked, Sentence Imposed.

Defendant Stephean A Hoya in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R. Fragoso.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Christine Bohn, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court orders the following: 

Count 1:
- 64 days Straight Time. Credit for 64 days.  COURT DEEMS TIME SERVED.
- Court maintains costs as previously imposed.

Count 2:
- 6 months: first 3 months Straight Time; last 3 months Huber.  All 6 months STAYED and defendant to be released to Day Report 
- 6 months jail.  First 3 months Straight Time, last 3 months Huber, ALL 6 months Stayed.  HUBER WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.
- DAY REPORT CENTER:  120 days.  If defendant successfully completes Day Report Center, the 6 months previously imposed will be permanently stayed.
- Court maintains costs as previously imposed.
